channel.title: Compiler error help?

item.title: Compiler error help?
item.dc:creator: @DreamCream DreamCream
item.description:
@DreamCream wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:8, topic:454461”][code]src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:482: error: illegal start of expr
ession
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights =
= 2) && c.playerrights == 3) {

 ^

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:482: error: ‘;’ expected
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights =
= 2) && c.playerrights == 3) {

                       ^

2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Read what it says, Error: ‘;’ expected… So add the ; where is shows a ^
Work the rest out yourself :D[/quote]

Nononono…
It’s confused… It’s because he put a “)” at the end of “c.playerRights == 2” so it’s thinking it would be like this…
(c.playerRights == 2);

He just has to do what I had said… But he hasn’t been online since.

Read full topic

= 2) && c.playerrights == 3) {

item.title: Compiler error help?
item.dc:creator: @fier12 fier12
item.description:
@fier12 wrote:

use this command i give you delete that one that has errors in it…

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 25000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
			}

item.title: Compiler error help?
item.dc:creator: @DreamCream DreamCream
item.description:
@DreamCream wrote:

Smh…
FIRST OF ALL
This code is saying you have to be playerRights 2 & 3…
Which doesn’t make any sense whatsoever…
Try changing your code to this:

			if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
				try {
					String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3) {
						int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
						int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
						if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
							c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
						} else {
							c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
						}
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("Wrong usage ::item_ID_Amount");
					}
				} catch(Exception e) {
					
			} 
		}

But you most likely have a different item amount… So try this…

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item") && (c.playerRights == 2) || (c.playerrights == 3)) {

Read full topic
